sdsmt.edu.thompsonsamson.assignment2

Class ViewDetailFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • sdsmt.edu.thompsonsamson.assignment2.ViewDetailFragment

  • public class ViewDetailFragment
extends Fragment
    The View Detail Fragment shows the details of a contact. Users can edit contact information and save it with a menu. Contact information is saved to a bundle and here.

      • ViewDetailFragment

        public ViewDetailFragment()

    • Method Detail

      • checkEditMode

        private void checkEditMode()
        Checks the edit mode to enable or disable the GUI objects. This affects the EditText fields and the save contact button.
        See Also:
        enableEditMode(), disableEditMode()

      • configureUiObjects

        private void configureUiObjects(View v)
        Sets up the GUI items. These include finding the EditText resources and creating the save button. Also an anonymous inner class is used for the button click listener.
        Parameters:
        v - the current view

      • disableEditMode

        private void disableEditMode()
        Disables the EditText fields and hides the save button

      • displayContact

        private void displayContact()
        Fill the EditText fields with the current contact information. If the contact is new, enable edit mode also.
        See Also:
        enableEditMode()

      • enableEditMode

        private void enableEditMode()
        Enables the EditText fields and shows the save button

      • hideKeyboard

        private void hideKeyboard()
        Hides the keyboard if open. This is done if they keyboard isn't closed before hitting save button.

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach(Activity activity)
        Attaches the fragment view to host activity
        Parameters:
        activity - the fragment's host activity

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Creates the detail fragment view

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public void onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu,
                       MenuInflater inflater)
        If the contact isn't new, inflate the detail menu resource item
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu being created
        inflater - object to inflate a resource to a menu

      • onCreateView

        public View onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater,
                ViewGroup container,
                Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Creates and returns the view associated with the fragment
        Returns:
        returns the root view
        See Also:
        configureUiObjects(View), checkEditMode()

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Controls the action of the menu, edit or delete contact
        Parameters:
        item - the action selected from the menu
        Returns:
        if a menu item was clicked or not

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        When pause occurs, get the orientation change flag

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Resumes the fragment view and display contact information
        See Also:
        displayContact()

      • sendDeleteContactAlert

        private void sendDeleteContactAlert()
        Displays an alertDialog to confirm deletion of a contact. If the user clicks the "OK" button the delete proceeds, if not, we return to edit.

      • sendEmptyContactAlert

        private boolean sendEmptyContactAlert()
        Checks to see if the user is trying to save a contact with no data in any field. If they are then a warning is displayed. If not false is returned.
        Returns:
        boolean true if warning is displayed, false if a field has data
